proof:
Let $k = |V_G(\gamma)|$. By construction, the subgraph of $G$ induced on $V_G(\gamma)$ is connected. Hence, this subgraph has at least $k-1$ edges. As $\beta < \beta_1$, we have $\zeta(\beta) > \xi(\beta)$. Therefore, Fact 4.4 yields
$$ w^{\mathrm{dis}}(\gamma) \le \exp(k \cdot \xi(\beta) - (k-1) \cdot \zeta(\beta)). $$
Thus, there is a constant $c = c(\beta) > 0$ such that
$$ w^{\mathrm{dis}}(\gamma) \le \exp(-ck). $$
The assertion follows for sufficiently large $A$ because $k \ge A \log n/d$.
